column4: Hi guys, I have got a folder full of files, I would like to concatanate another file onto the end of all these. Is there an easy way of doing this?
I think: 'for $i in *; do cat foo >> $i; done' may work
I thought something like that might. Thanks for the pointer
well it might if you get rid of the first $, so  'for i in *; do cat foo >> $i; done'
ls /bin > ~/Desktop/doubletabs.txt && ls /sbin >> ~/Desktop/doubletabs.txt      :)
I came into the middle of this one, I am not entirely sure what you are trying to do! :)
I get the idea, thanks :)
> pipes to a file  >> appends to a file
gnomefreak: why would you sue sudo in your home directory?
riomerc : Can you please stop spamming the channel with all your bot requests. Use /msg ubotu blah blah blah....
riomerc : if you want to tell someone about something use:  /msg ubotu tell selinium about shutup   :)
that doesn't work well because people won't know if people have been told about things already or not
it does, try sending me the same 'tell' twice..
yes and that means that people will waste their time typing things
against people not getting there question 'heard' because of too much noise... :)
Don't get me wrong, you do a great job in here! :)

thanks, I understand where you are coming from, but I really do think it's counter-productive to has 20 people type the same /msg to ubotu when they could be working on the next question once they see someone already sent the info
I do see your point. I see it as a typing challenge to get there first :)   It can get very noisy when three people are doing it at the same time. :)    I really do see yout point though  :)
Oh yeah... Forgot shhd isn't running as standard!
packages.ubuntu.com
cheers and Hi! :)
